# Function reference {.doc .doc-index}

## tame_your_files

Pure, non-destructive filesystem analysis utilities.

| | |
| --- | --- |
| [FileInfo](FileInfo.qmd#tame_your_files.FileInfo) | Container for file metadata. |
| [files_to_free_space](files_to_free_space.qmd#tame_your_files.files_to_free_space) | Determine the minimum number of files that would need to be deleted |
| [largest_files](largest_files.qmd#tame_your_files.largest_files) | Recursively scan a directory and return the n largest files. |
| [find_duplicates_by_content](find_duplicates_by_content.qmd#tame_your_files.find_duplicates_by_content) | Finds duplicate files based on file content (MD5 hash) within a given directory and its subdirectories. |
| [find_duplicates_by_name](find_duplicates_by_name.qmd#tame_your_files.find_duplicates_by_name) | Finds duplicate files based on file names within a given directory and its subdirectories. |
| [find_duplicates_by_size](find_duplicates_by_size.qmd#tame_your_files.find_duplicates_by_size) | Finds duplicate files based on file sizes within a given directory and its subdirectories. |
| [create_treemap_figure](create_treemap_figure.qmd#tame_your_files.create_treemap_figure) | Transforms the flat list into a Plotly Treemap object. |
| [get_directory_data](get_directory_data.qmd#tame_your_files.get_directory_data) | Walks the directory and builds a representative list of dictionaries of all children. Uses os.walk to capture every file and folder. |
